title: Native window decorations for Thunderbird 115 on KDE Plasma
content:
I can't seem to find the option to disable the new unified toolbar in TB 115 and get back native window decorations for Thunderbird. Where is it? :)

Two screenshots attached: One shows my current Thunderbird title bar, second shows how native title bars on my system look.

In particular: - I would like to the buttons from the symbol bar below the title bar (I need to be able to drag the window at arbitrary points in the title bar) - I would like to have an application icon on the very left of the title bar that allows me to close the window on double click. - I would like to have my additional title bar buttons (see attached screenshot) - I would like Thunderbird to respect the font choices for the titlebars of my desktop enviroment

Thunderbird really is the only application on my computer that does not support these three things. I get that the new toolbar looks nice on Gnome, but on KDE, it is the odd one out...
creator: daniel-r.schmidt

title: Cannot import email
content: Tbird finds the email account but says "Unable to log in at server" I have checked all the variables, email, password etc many times.

title: How to save emails that ONLY have attachements in the mail.
content:
Hi,

I have FiltaQuilla involved and run a filter that saves a Thunderbird email contents as .eml file to a folder and attachement of the email to another folder. Is there any filter setting that will only run the filter ONLY if the email has an attachment? I could not find any such way to do this.

Thanks

Kris
creator: ksantwani

title: Levelezés lementése pc-re helytakarékosság céljából
content:
Abban lenne segítségre szükségem, hogy milyen módon lehet letölteni a levelezést a pc-re, hogy olvashatóak és elérhetőek maradjanak változatlan formában (beérkezett, elküldött levelek mappa), de a tárhelyszolgáltatómnál már ne legyen ott, ne foglalja a tárhelyet.

Egyszóval törölni a leveleket, úgy, hogy helyi szinten elérhetőek maradjanak.

Köszönöm! Péter
creator: szabopeter

title: Thunderbird stops fetching new messages
content:
I have Thunderbird configured to fetch new messages every 2 minutes, but sometimes it stops looking for new messages. Last Monday, when I went looking at the emails that I received during the weekend I only had emails from Friday. As I receive on my email notifications from several daily backups I knew that there were messages missing, so I had to manually tel Thunderbird to fetch new messages to be able to see the messages from Saturday and Sunday.

This happens almost every day.

PS: I never turn off the computer and I only close Thunderbird when I think it's using too much memory, like a few minutes ago, when it was using almost 300MB instead of the usual less than 200MB.
creator: arturpires1

title: Altering Hotmail access password within Thunderbird?
content:
How do I alter the password - presumably stored within Thunderbird on my laptop - which gives me access to my Hotmail account ? I had to alter the password directly with Hotmail, but it seems as if I didn't alter the old version stored on my laptop. In hope, Chris 

I'm currently using TB  version  115.1.0 (32-bit), still under Windows7
creator: wolery6

title: New Mac, no Thunderbird downloads
content: I bought a MacBook Air but am having two issues with Thunderbird: 1. The same 2 emails kept downloading repeatedly. I googled the issue and removed the popstate.dat from the profile in question. 1 of each have downloaded since. 2. I got the new MBA on 8.8.23 and migrated the same settings (via icloud) from my old MacBook Pro. I have checked, the Thunderbird settings appear to be the same in both MacBooks. The second issue is that no emails downloaded since, although the bottom notification said 'Downloading 3 of 49' then almost immediately 'No messages to download'. NB. Just checked T'bird again: deleted the 2 emails, quit TB, deleted popstate.dat > notification, reopened TB > 'Downloading 3 of 53', those 2 emails came back > 'No messages to download' Any help appreciated. (I will check the webmail in a few hours to see if there's a reply). Thanks.
creator: gfinley

content:

title: Thunderbird is laggy and locks up
content:
I experience, as man others in the forum, that T-Bird locks the cursor, and everything goes to a halt. You can actually keep typing, and most of the text will appear when the "lag is over". The issue started more than a year ago when I set up a new laptop with pre installed W10, so it was a blank installation of T-Bird. I fiddled a bit with the below registry settings, it primarily take care of resource eating nonsense from MS - it helped a bit, not much.

All this just to say, you have a problem at the T-Bird developer team, I'm not the only person reporting this, but support don't know their head from the tail.

I'm running WIN10 and have no plans of upgrading for now.

I'm not suspecting the computer which is a new one with an I7 processor and 16Gb RAM

================================================================

Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\location] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\webcam] "Value"="Deny"

title: Can't see messages in inbox
content: Strange issue just happened to me. I have several email accounts in Thunderbird v102.14.0. Only having a problem with my Hotmail account inbox. I'm unable to see any messages in the inbox. The messages are there, but they don't show. If I click an area in the inbox, the message displays. The other folders in this account display. Only having a problem with the inbox. Hope this makes sense to someone that can help me me able to see inbox messages. I tried a PC restart, but that was no help. Compacted that folder too.

title: Access to Telstra mail is suddenly not available
content: For years I have accessed my email "graham.kruck@bigpond.com" via Thunderbird. Suddenly I could not access it except via webmail. Is this a problem with Thunderbird or Telstra please? It is so frustrating trying to speak to someone to sort out these issues but maybe you can advise me who to call if this is not in your domain. Thanks, Graham
